extracted_rules.rule: Recessed Porch Gross Floor Area Exclusion

Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to recessed porches located on the ground floor (1st floor).
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Porches that do not meet all specified criteria. Porches not on the ground floor. Porches with ceilings at or above the 2nd floor.

Variables.porch_depth: Dimensional. The depth of the recessed porch.
Variables.porch_ceiling_location: Dimensional. The vertical position of the porch ceiling relative to the 2nd floor.
Variables.porch_openness: Material/Usage. The state of the exterior side of the porch.

Conditions.Mandatory: To be excluded from GFA, a logical AND of three conditions must be met.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF (Depth of porch < 10') AND (Porch ceiling is below 2nd floor) AND (Exterior side is substantially open) THEN the porch area does NOT count toward gross floor area. ELSE, it DOES count.
Conditions.Dependencies: The outcome (exclusion from GFA) is dependent on satisfying all three criteria simultaneously.

Exceptions.Explicit Deviations: None. The rule is conditional, not exception-based.
Exceptions.Special Cases: If the porch area does count toward GFA, it may be subject to an additional penalty if its height exceeds 17 feet (see 'One-Story Construction Height' rule).

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a specific criterion within the broader regulations for calculating Gross Floor Area.
Relationships.Cross-references: Refers to the city policy on one-story construction height (Note on Page 20) for calculating GFA for non-compliant, tall porches.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: The GFA exclusion is logically dependent on the AND combination of the depth, ceiling height, and openness conditions.

Flags.Ambiguous Language: The term 'substantially open' is not quantitatively defined and is subject to interpretation.

extracted_rules.rule: One-Story Construction Height and 2nd Story Equivalency

Qualifiers.Scope: Defines the height limit for one-story construction for the purpose of GFA calculation.
Qualifiers.Applicability: City-wide policy applied to spaces like porches when their area is included in GFA calculations.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Construction that is less than 17 feet above finished floor.

Variables.space_height: Dimensional. The height of a construction space, measured from the finished floor.

Conditions.Mandatory: This is a mandatory city policy for GFA calculation.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF a space's area counts toward GFA AND its height is greater than 17 feet above finished floor, THEN its area is counted a second time ('counts twice') in the GFA calculation.
Conditions.Dependencies: The application of the GFA multiplier is dependent on the space first being included in the GFA calculation and then exceeding the height threshold.

Exceptions.Special Cases: This rule itself is a special case or penalty applied to tall spaces.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This is a supplementary city policy that modifies the GFA calculation under specific height conditions.
Relationships.Cross-references: This rule is explicitly linked to the 'Recessed Porch GFA Exclusion' rule as a consequence for non-compliance combined with excessive height.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: Logically dependent on a space's area being counted towards GFA in the first place.

Flags.Ambiguous Language: The reference point for 'finished floor' is not specified (e.g., the finished floor of the ground story, or the floor of the space in question).
